title: Britney Spears’ break from music ‘could last 10 years’
text:
Britney’s taking some much-needed time out (Picture: Getty Images, WireImage)

Britney Spears’ break from her music career may be longer than expected, as sources say the singer could take up to 10 years away from the spotlight.

The Toxic singer cancelled her Las Vegas residency in February to focus on her mental health, and later spent time in a ‘wellness facility’.

As fans desperately await Britney’s return to the stage at some point in the very near future, sources say the wait could be extended to up to a decade.

An insider told Heat magazine: ‘Britney’s made the decision to take a long break from performing.

‘Of course, it was an extremely tough decision, because she loves being on-stage and adores her fans, but she also knows it’s a necessary step.’

In recent months, Britney, 37, has been embroiled in a legal battle regarding her conservatorship after her father, Jamie Spears, was temporarily relinquished control of some of her affairs.

According to the insider, Britney ‘wants to take back control of her life’ and is keen to ‘prove she’s capable of looking after herself and living without the conservatorship’.

Britney was forced to pull out of her Vegas shows earlier this year (Picture: WireImage)

The insider claimed: ‘She’s been speaking to a new lawyer who advised that it will take up to 10 years to fully regain control. So, Britney made a conscious decision to give up her career while she fights.

‘Thankfully, she’s being 100 percent supported by [her boyfriend] Sam [Ashgari] and her mum [Lynne]. Britney’s calling them her secret army – she says they’re helping her to finally break free from the nightmare of this ridiculous agreement.’

The reports come after Britney gave fans an update on her wellbeing last week and discussed the ‘life transition’ she’s currently going through.

‘I hope y’all haven’t forgotten about me!!!’ Britney explained.

‘I’m taking this transition in my life to focus on what I really want … I’ve been working nonstop, well, since I was 8 years old in the business.

‘Sometimes it’s good to stop and reflect !!!! Miss you all … I really do have the best fans in the world !!! [sic].’

Metro.co.uk has contacted Britney’s reps for comment.
